title: 112_hr3012
content: The Act titled "Fairness for High-Skilled Immigrants Act of 2011" imposes a numerical limitation on visas from any single foreign state. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to make changes to visa limitations and subsections. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to make changes to visa limitations and subsections, including striking certain subsections and amending others to address immigrant visa availability for natives of specific countries. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to address immigrant visa availability for natives of specific countries by implementing special rules for countries at ceiling to allocate visa numbers in a manner that complies with the numerical limitation specified. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to allocate visa numbers for natives of specific countries in a manner that complies with numerical limitations. The Chinese Student Protection Act of 1992 is also amended to adjust country-specific offsets. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to allocate visa numbers for natives of specific countries in compliance with numerical limitations. The Chinese Student Protection Act of 1992 is also amended to adjust country-specific offsets, with changes effective from September 30, 2011, applying to fiscal years starting from 2012. Transition rules for employment-based immigrants are outlined. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to allocate visa numbers for natives of specific countries in compliance with numerical limitations. Transition rules for employment-based immigrants are outlined, with changes effective from September 30, 2011, applying to fiscal years starting from 2012. For fiscal years 2012 and 2013, a percentage of immigrant visas will be allocated to natives of specific countries based on previous visa numbers. For fiscal years 2012 and 2013, a percentage of immigrant visas will be allocated to natives of specific countries based on previous visa numbers. In fiscal year 2013, 10 percent of immigrant visas under each paragraph will go to immigrants from states not among the top two in visa numbers in 2011. In fiscal year 2014, the same allocation will apply. For fiscal year 2014, 10 percent of immigrant visas under each paragraph will be allotted to immigrants from states not among the top two in visa numbers in 2012. In fiscal year 2012, the number of immigrant visas for natives of a single foreign state or dependent area cannot exceed 25% or 2% respectively of the total reserved visas. In fiscal years 2012, 2013, and 2014, no more than 85% of immigrant visas under paragraphs (2) and (3) of section 203(b) of the Act shall be allotted to natives of any single foreign state. In fiscal years 2012, 2013, and 2014, not more than 85% of immigrant visas shall be allotted to natives of any single foreign state to prevent unused visas. In fiscal years 2012, 2013, and 2014, not more than 85% of immigrant visas shall be allotted to natives of any single foreign state to prevent unused visas. Rules for chargeability under section 202(b) of the Act apply in determining the foreign state an alien is chargeable to for visa purposes. The House of Representatives passed the bill on November 29, 2011. Karen L. Haas is the Clerk.
